originalTitle: Mali lawmaker jailed in Ivory Coast for insulting president
title: Mali lawmaker jailed in Ivory Coast for insulting president
content: Prosecutors say Mamadou Hawa Gassama described Alassane Ouattara as a "tyrant" and "an enemy of Mali".

originalTitle: South Africa and Israel expel each other's envoys in diplomatic row
title: Countries and Friends: A Story from South Africa!
content:
Hello, Friends! A Story About Countries!

Hello, my wonderful friends all over Africa! I'm your special news reporter, and today we have a story about two countries. Imagine countries are like very, very big families. Sometimes, these big families are great friends and help each other. Sometimes, just like friends, they can have disagreements. Our story today is about two countries: South Africa, which is a wonderful country right here in Africa, and a country called Israel, which is far, far away.

What is an "Envoy"?

Now, for our story, we need to learn a big word: "envoy." What is an envoy? Imagine you have a very important message for a friend who lives far away. You might send a special messenger to deliver it for you. An envoy is like that special messenger! An envoy is a person who works for their country and goes to another country to talk for them. They help countries be friends and understand each other. They are like special helpers who keep the conversations going between countries. Did you know? These special helpers are sometimes called "ambassadors"! They live in another country to help keep everyone talking nicely.

A Big Disagreement

So, South Africa and Israel had these special helpers, these envoys, in each other's countries. But something happened that made one country very, very sad and upset. In South Africa, we have a very important leader. He is called the President. Our President is like the head of our big family, the country. His name is President Cyril Ramaphosa. He works very hard to make sure everyone in South Africa is safe and happy. Sadly, South Africa said that Israel's special helper, their envoy, said some not-so-nice things about our President. When someone says mean things about your leader, it can make everyone in your country feel very hurt and disrespected. It's like someone being unkind to your dad or mom; it makes you feel bad too!

South Africa Says "Go Home!"

Because South Africa felt so upset by what they heard, they made a very big decision. They decided to ask Israel's special helper, their envoy, to go home. When a country asks an envoy to go home, we say they "expel" them. It means they want that special helper to leave and not stay in their country anymore. It's like when you have a friend over, and they say something very mean, and you ask them to please go home. South Africa felt that because the envoy said unkind things about their President, they could not work together nicely anymore. So, they asked the special helper from Israel to pack their bags and go back to their own country. This was a very serious step, showing how upset South Africa was feeling. Our country values respect very much. Did you know? South Africa is famous for its beautiful wildlife, like lions and elephants! It's also home to many different people who speak different languages.

Israel Says "No, You Go Home!"

Now, when South Africa asked Israel's helper to leave, Israel heard about it. Israel said that South Africa's reason for asking their helper to leave was "baseless." This means Israel felt that South Africa's reason was not fair or true. They felt it was wrong to ask their special helper to go home. So, Israel got upset too! They decided to do the same thing back to South Africa. Israel said, "If you ask our helper to leave, then we will ask your helper to leave too!" So, Israel told South Africa's special helper, their envoy, to also go home. This is called "reciprocal expulsion" – when one country does something, and the other country does the same thing back. It shows that both countries are very, very upset with each other right now.

What Does This Mean?

When countries ask each other's special helpers to go home, it means they are having a "diplomatic row." That's another big phrase! "Diplomacy" is how countries talk to each other to solve problems and be friends. So, a "diplomatic row" means countries are not talking very much right now, or they are very angry with each other. It makes it hard for them to work together or understand each other. It's like when two friends are so angry that they stop talking and won't play together for a while. It's a sad time because talking is how we solve problems. Without their special helpers, it's harder for South Africa and Israel to share messages and try to make things better. They don't have those important messengers in each other's countries anymore. Did you know? There are almost 200 countries in the world! Each one has its own leaders and special ways of doing things.

Why Is Talking Important?

Talking is super important for everyone, especially for countries. When countries talk, they can learn from each other, trade things, and even help each other when there are problems, like big storms or sickness. Our continent, Africa, knows how important it is for countries to work together. When special helpers are sent home, it means the talking has stopped, and that can make things more difficult. We always hope that countries can find ways to talk things out, even when they are very upset. It takes courage and kindness to try and understand someone else's feelings, even if you disagree. Just like with your friends, it's always better to find a way to talk and play again, rather than stay angry.

Hoping for Friendship

So, for now, South Africa and Israel have asked each other's special helpers to go home. This means they are not talking directly as much as they used to. It's a tricky situation, like when friends have a really big fight. Everyone hopes that these two countries can find a way to talk again soon. We hope they can remember that being respectful and kind is important, even when they have different ideas or are feeling upset. We will keep watching and hope that peace and understanding can grow between these countries. Maybe one day, they can send their special helpers back, and start talking nicely again. That's what diplomacy is all about – finding ways for countries to be good neighbours, even if they live far apart. Let's send our good wishes for peace and understanding to everyone involved.
summary: South Africa and Israel have asked each other's special helpers (envoys) to go home because South Africa felt Israel's helper said mean things about their leader, and Israel felt it was unfair, making both countries upset and stopping their direct talks for now.
whyMatters: This is important because when countries stop talking and send their helpers home, it makes it harder for them to solve problems peacefully and be friends, which can affect people in both countries and even others around the world.

originalTitle: Music legend Fela Kuti becomes first African to get Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award
title: Music legend Fela Kuti becomes first African to get Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award
content: Almost 30 years after he died, the Nigerian will posthumously receive a Lifetime Achievement Award.

title: Bombardier stock dives on Trump threats of 50% tariff on Canadian planes
content: Trump threatened decertifying Bombardier's planes and slapping new tariffs if Canada did not certify rival US planes.

title: UN risks 'imminent financial collapse', secretary general warns
content: António Guterres says the international body could run out of money by July due to members' unpaid fees.

title: Trump picks Kevin Warsh to lead the US Federal Reserve
content: The 55-year-old economist had been considered for Fed chair during Trump's first term.

title: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty if convicted, judge rules
content: A judge dismisses two federal counts against the 27-year-old, but he still faces state murder charges.

title: Carrick not ruling out Man Utd deadline day moves

originalTitle: Are Arsenal fans making team nervous in title race?
title: Are Arsenal fans making team nervous in title race?
content: Is a nervousness among Arsenal fans affecting the players in the Premier League title race? Alex Howell looks at what impact this could have on Mikel Arteta's side as they look to end a run of three second-placed finishes.

originalTitle: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
title: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
content: Benfica will face Real Madrid in the Champions League play-offs just three weeks after their dramatic league phase encounter.
